greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of endofunctions on [n] such that at least one preimage with cardinality >=k exists and a nonempty preimage of j implies that all i<=j have preimages with cardinality >=k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: In general, column k > 1 is asymptotic to n! / ((1+r^(k-1)/(k-1)!) * r^(n+1)), where r is the root of the equation 2 - exp(r) + Sum_{j=1..k-1} r^j/j! = 0. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 02 2014
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
formula: E.g.f. (for column k > 0): 1/(2 -exp(x) +Sum_{j=1..k-1} x^j/j!) -1. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 02 2014
mathematica: b[n_, k_] := b[n, k] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[b[n-j, k]*Binomial[n, j], {j, k, n}]]; T[n_, k_] := If[k == 0, n^n, If[n == 0, 0, b[n, k]]]; T[0, 0] = 1; Table[Table[T[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 05 2015, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Jul 30 2014
